items.title: Long-range order enhance performance of patterned blue quantum dot light-emitting diodes
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62345-1 Jia et al. report an aromatic ligand to regulate the interparticle interaction of blue colloidal quantum dots. Combined with using micropillar templates to segment liquid film, long-range ordered quantum dot array is formed, enabling an efficiency of 18.3% with pixel size of 3 µm for blue LEDs.

items.title: Pangenome analysis of transposable element insertion polymorphisms reveals features underlying cold tolerance in rice
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62887-4 Transposable elements (TEs) play important role in plant adaptive evolution. Here, the authors assemble pangenomes consisting of 10 rice accessions with a broad spectrum of temperature adaptability and reveal TE insertion polymorphisms of the candidate genes in cold tolerance.

items.title: Ultrahigh thermoelectricity obtained in classical BiSbTe alloy processed under super-gravity
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62611-2 The authors develop a super-gravity field remelting fabrication technology which is effective in synergistically optimizing the electrical and thermal transport properties. Under a super-gravity field, the brittle (Bi,Sb)2Te3 alloy undergoes unusual plastic deformation during melt solidification.

items.title: Randomized phase I trial outcomes show safe and sustainable inhibition of classical and lectin complement pathways by empasiprubart
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62925-1 Though the complement system is pivotal in the defence against infections, pathologic activation of the system contributes to disease. Here, authors show that their recently developed monoclonal antibody against complement factor 2, empasiprubart, inhibits the classical and lectin pathways in a clinical trial, and its crystal structure provides basis for its inhibitory properties, such as Ca2+ binding.

items.title: Regulatory T cell therapy promotes TGF-β and IL-6-dependent pro-inflammatory Th17 cell generation by reducing IL-2
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62628-7 Regulatory T cell therapy has shown some success therapeutically in the context of autoimmunity and transplantation. Here the authors explore the impact of IL-6, TGF-β and IL-2 on pathogenic Th17 cell generation post regulatory T cell therapy, and show therapeutic blockade of IL-6/STAT3 can reduce their generation in murine models of inflammatory disease.

items.title: Unconventional phase metal heteronanostructures with tunable exposed interface for efficient tandem nitrate electroreduction to ammonia
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63013-0 Tandem catalysts are important in electrocatalysis but suffer from uncontrollable interfaces, limited crystal phases, and complex synthesis. Here, the authors report the facile synthesis of hetero-phase 4H/fcc Au–Cu tandem catalysts with tunable interfaces for ammonia electrosynthesis from nitrate.

items.title: ROSIE: AI generation of multiplex immunofluorescence staining from histopathology images
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62346-0 Hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) staining is a widely used method in histopathology, but it cannot directly inform about specific molecular markers. Here, the authors present ROSIE, a deep-learning framework that computationally imputes the expression and localisation of dozens of proteins from H&E images.

items.title: Cholecystectomy-related gut microbiota dysbiosis exacerbates colorectal tumorigenesis
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62956-8 Cholecystectomy is associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer, and the underlying mechanism remains elusive. Here, the authors show that cholecystectomy-related microbiome and bile acid alterations disrupts the FXR/β-catenin interaction, and ultimately exacerbates colorectal tumorigenesis.

items.title: Landau-level composition of bound exciton states in magnetic field
authors: Dinh Van Tuan and Hanan Dery
items.summary: An exciton – a bound electron-hole pair – is inert to the Lorentz force due to its charge neutrality. As such, the motion of an exciton cannot be described by the same Landau quantization that characterizes the motion of a free electron or hole in magnetic field. This contrast raises the question: How can a bound exciton state in magnetic field be expressed through the Landau quantization of its electron and hole components? Here, the authors establish a scattering selection rule between the Landau levels { n e , n h } of the electron and hole components, and identify an elegant pairing law between these Landau levels, n e = n h + l . The pairing law provides information on the construction of a bound exciton state with magnetic quantum number l , and on the interaction of the exciton magnetic moment with magnetic field. [Phys. Rev. B 112, 085305] Published Fri Aug 15, 2025

items.title: Scalable photonic quantum technologies
